Build a Copy of an Item
One of the families requested an adoption. The child should arrive in the following days.
Animal has reached the end of their journey and quietly passed away.
Animals need nutrition to keep on living.
Secure your domesticated animals from danger.
Take care of your new friend, and don't let it eat up your crops!
An artisan family has been very unhappy with their life here and they left with all of their wealth.
The assassination attempt has been uncovered and your reputation suffers!
An artisan family could not maintain the donations with the clergy and left. Consider donating less yourself, to make it easier for them.
Villagers can't reach one of your buildings. Make sure there is a free path to at least one of the access points.
Caravan has arrived. They will soon offer their goods in a storefront at the caravan marketplace.
Disruptions to the marketplace caused a caravan to leave earlier than planned.
The celebration could not proceed in the planned manner and have been canceled.
The celebrations have begun and everyone rejoices together!
The adopted child has been accompanied to their new family.
Intelligence has been gathered. Review the findings in the reporting tab of the targeted family.
The coup grows in numbers and it has become dangerous. Act before they overthrow your government!
There are rumors about a growing artisan coup. Investigate families and uncover their leader before it is too late!
One of your villagers committed a serious crime. Rumors spread quickly and unrest will grow. Recruit guards and setup guard posts, to prevent them!
A criminal have been captured by your guards. Consider changing their sentence length or order an execution in the population book.
Criminal was released back to freedom after serving their sentence.
You have been granted supplies to continue your journey.
Scheduled execution is underway. Everyone gathers for the event.
Goods sent to a family have been delivered. Your relationship is improving while other noble families express disagreement.
The royalty supports your efforts in expanding your land and has granted you favor.
A member of the high council has been lost either due to death or negative relationships with an involved family.
You did not have enough execution displays to execute everyone. Build more, or wait for the next event for the rest to be executed.
Resources you were selling are out of stock. Consider changing the amount or removing the listing.
One of the resources you were selling was completely sold out. Consider updating your offer.
Novice has finished their studies and become a monk.
Your actions have unlocked a secret game module! You will see them next time you start a new game.
There is no jail or enough empty jail benches to put criminals in and guards had to release a criminal to freedom!
Public execution should conclude today, but there was no public stage available and the event has been rescheduled. Make sure you build a public stage near the execution displays.
A family that you invited has arrived and will reside in your villa for the next few days.
The invited noble family have left your settlement. As a result of their diplomatic visit, your relationship is changing.
One of the noble houses has sent you a gift in appreciation of your diplomatic relationships.
This organization does not have the necessary funds to buy the services of a professional builder.
The clergy did not success and their propaganda had a negative effect. Your ruler reputation is reduced.
The clergy managed to paint you in a positive light. Your ruler reputation grows.
All members of the regiment perished in the war. Sorrow and sadness spread through the settlement.
A regiment has returned from war! All surviving members received the war veteran skill.
The uprising grows in numbers and it has become dangerous. Act before they take into arms!
There are rumors about a growing peasant uprising. Investigate families and uncover their leader before it is too late!
A resource is not profitable and villagers have stopped purchasing resources to make them. Consider stopping the production and find better balance of supply and demand.
Production of a resource is profitable again and villager have resumed the trade.
The peasants could not overwhelm your guards and gave up. The uprising is weakened, but may be still out there.
The delivery of goods to the royal family has been completed. You have been awarded favor.
The negative diplomatic relationship with another noble house bears consequences. The house is using its influence to damage your reputation with the royalty.
Quests from the royal family have been updated
The whole settlement gathers to practice their faith.
Access to this structure is blocked.
The tax collector will take resources from your warehouses and leave when finished.
Time for your villeins to pay what they owe you on taxes. They will transfer what they can into your warehouse in the following moments.
Build more storages, ideally close to where villagers produce resources.
A caravan got injured and stories travel around that it is not safe to travel here. There will be no caravans for several days.
A visitor got injured and stories travel around that it is not safe to travel here. There will be no visitors for several days.
Your people had enough! They took in arms and you have to fight for your survival.
At young age, villagers will not perform physically demanding work and they will spend this time learning the craft from their mentors.
A villager did not survive the battle and died in the war.
Hopefully they are in a better place now.
Make sure there is enough heat sources and your villagers have enough clothes.
Shelters with rooftops are a great way to combat high temperatures.
Well-suited armor and shield is an effective protection against any aggression.
They did not survive their illness and passed away.
They were target of a horrific murder and they did not survive the attack.
They paid for their sins and died after a dishonorable execution.
One of your villagers voluntarily joined the clergy.
One of your villagers has been blessed with the gift of life. Expect a new family member in the upcoming days!
Your villagers are fighting each other! Make sure your villagers are happy if you want to avoid these situations.
Villagers have married! We wish them a long and happy relationship filled with joy.
Opposition has been fully dismantled and they pose no danger anymore.
Opposition has been fully dismantled and they pose no danger anymore.
You have completed the tutorial section of this mission. You may choose to finish it or continue your adventures by returning to the main menu.
All of your remote settlements have paid their dues and the tax colelctor is delivering their payment.
A caravan from another noble house has arrived to trade with goods set in your trade agreement.
Enemy Of Your Friend Is Your Enemy
Accepting will immediately enlist this person as your servant.
Accepting will cause you to step down peacefully. Your family will lose their position as the ruler and be exiled from this settlement. (Game Over)
Accepting will cause the following pair enter into a marriage and one of them will join the listed family:
Accepting will improve your relationship, but harm the relationship with the targeted family by
Accepting will slightly harm your relationship with clergy and improve relationship with clergy of the requesting family.
Accepting will immediately release the targeted person from your service and rejoin their family.
Accepting will create a new family, with this person as the head of the family. They will keep portion of the current family's wealth and leave with all of their children and grandchildren:
To satisfy this request, you shall release the following person from the military:
Accepting will immediately recruit this person into the military.
Accepting will immediately exile the targeted family.
Accepting will immediately release the targeted person from jail.
Accepting will schedule a celebration in the next few days.
To satisfy this request, you shall reduce the taxes and set them to
Accepting will cause this family to immediately leave your settlement. They will only take their money with them.
Accepting will spare all members of the coup and improve your relationship with their families. The coup will be fully dismantled.
To satisfy this request, you shall raise the payment and set it to
To satisfy this request, you shall grant this family the following resources:
To satisfy this request, you shall grant this family the following resources:

Accepting will immediately send the targeted person to the jail.
Accepting will immediately send the targeted person to the jail.
I submit myself to you with the deepest desire to serve you. Please, allow me to join the courtyard. I swear you will not regret your choice!
It has been far too long that a weak-minded ruler like you to reside in these halls. Step down peacefully and we may spare you!
Let it be known that our love is as deep as the richness of your treasury and as wide as your might and glory. We humbly ask you to give us your blessing for our marriage!
I know it is strategic of you to keep this family on your land, but it is insulting what they do to your reputation. Show that you are on our side and denounce their actions.
Our presence here is of great importance and we understand that you would like to keep it that way. I'm sure you would not mind sharing some of your wealth with your allies?
The food is short to come by and we are hardly surviving. We humbly ask you, please, have mercy and share with us your spoils, or we fear that the end is near for us.
Our faith is strong, but the clergy is struggling to recognize it. Put a word for us by the bishop. Share stories of our faithfulness and we shall be grateful.
I approach you with the most humble desire. Please, release my love from your service. We can not be with each other and it breaks my heart!
Our family is growing and the land you've given to us is far too small. Please consider making me a pronounced head of our own family, so that we can serve you with honor!
We beg you, release our kin from the army. We fear that our loved one will not come back from the war. They are far more useful to you in the fields!
It has been long enough for me to work in the fields. Give me a weapon and purpose and I shall show you my might.
We tried to resolve our differences, but to no veil. We can't live on this land while they are around. Exile them and show that you stand by your people.
I demand justice! There is no need for a trial. I know they did it and I shall be damned if I'm wrong! They should be in thrown in jail for what they have done!
I know criminals must be punished, but our kin is the most pure and kind you could ever know. We are sure they have done nothing wrong. Please have mercy and release them!
There are stories among our people about your endless generosity and true greatness! Surely you would not mind sharing your wealth with your people?
We have been hard at work in all this year and yet, celebrations are so short to come by. Please, consider lifting the spirits of your people and host a gathering!
The existence of this person alone is a crime! Throw them in jail for a few days. Maybe that will have them reconsider how they treat their kin.
How is our family supposed to work, when the material that we need is so hard to come by! May you please find space in your treasury to share with your humble peasants?
We are working day and night and we can hardly get by like this. We ask you, please, reduce those taxes as they do you no good!
We approach you in a crucial time with a request most unusual. Our hearts are taking us off this land, but our oath to serve you is sacred and we must uphold it. Will you release us?
You've shown a strong ruling hand and your people stand behind you. There is nothing we can say in our defense. Spare us and we promise to do you good this time!
Our purse has but a few coins left and we can barely afford food. Please, share with us some of your wealth!
Making profit is difficult, though we see no profits of our own! You take all that we make, but the payments we receive are merely an insult to injury.
Basic roof made from straw. Protects from rain but easily breaks.
Structural roof that can sustain harsh conditions and maintain temperature well.
Poor isolation but more durable and can protect from rain.
Artisans of all professions will visit more often
The chances of soldiers surviving war are greatly improved
Criminal was executed recently. People are afraid to commit crimes
Family has been recently expelled or left
Visitors visit the settlement more often
For a limited time, the mood and happiness of all is improved
Hunters, butchers, tanners, leatherworkers, tailors and bowmakers will visit more often
Villagers commonly organize uprisings regardless of your reputation
On Sundays and during celebrations trade is stopped
Miners, smelters and masoners are more likely to visit
Locals are very religious and remain happy as long as they can attend Sunday Mass
Caravan got hurt and your land is known to be unsafe for travel
A visitor got hurt and your land is known to be unsafe for visits
Villagers rarely die from a disease

Used by priests to perform blessings.
Used by blacksmiths to shape the heated steel.
Table for apothecars to create healing materials.
Used by artists to make paintings.
A place to sell beers, meals, and bedrooms at the inn.
Barrels are useful to store ingredients like fish, fruits, and vegetables.
Wooden rails that can hold barrels with beer and wine.
Used by clergy for beekeeping in the apiary.
Big pot to grow useful plants.
With this stone table you can easily host impressive gatherings.
A great choice for regular big households.
Sturdy structure capable of sustaining high temperatures.
Barrel for fermenting an alcoholic beverage.
A workshop for the carpenters and architects to make repair kits.
Used by butchers to process and prepare meat.
Wooden cabinet to store clothes, armor, and equipment.
Can warm-up room and provide light.
Storage for traveling caravans. One storage per storefront for each caravan is sufficient.
A bar utilized by bartenders to serve meals and drinks during celebrations.
Rusty chest for crafting materials and precious items.
Used to mix and extract butter from milk.
Used by coin makers to turn ingots into valuable currency.
Basic table to prepare food and cook meals.
Used by blacksmiths to cool down the heated steel.
Extravagant chair dedicated only to the members of the high council.
Area designated for harvesting ground resources like sand and clay.
Small drawers to store clothing and equipment.
Sturdy, spacious and refined dining table with decorative elements.
Any noble family would love to have those.
Sitting in this chair is not just for comfort. It is a status symbol.
Highly refined with a beautiful silk sheet on top.
Marvelous work decorated with gold and gems.
Plowed land that can grow plants.
Filled with straw to separate beer from the wort.
Great source of warmth and relaxation.
Can trap fish. Effective when fishing but requires time.
Must be built on the shore facing the water.
Flailing the crops on the ground separates and filters the grains from plants.
Attracts wild animals to an area.
Burns wood for ash and combines it with sand to produce forest glass.
Sturdy addition to a wealthy dining hall.
High-quality table with large surface area.
Sturdy and perfect for outdoor environments.
Highly refined chair with perfected edges and decorative elements.
Work of a truly skilled craftsman.
Less resilient than stone, but still comfortable.
Spacious tub to mash the grapes and extract the nectar.
An area designated for a less organized storage.
Area designated for storing heavy resources.
Post for guards to occupy. Protects from criminals in the surrounding area.
Wooden door reinforced with wooden structure.
A hidden structure providing a better view for hunting.
Holds the honeycomb to separate the honey and vax.
A spooky decoration and a source of light!
A bench for prisoners in their cell. Each bench will increase the capacity of a jail by two prisoners.
Ugly chair for a captured criminal. Each chair will increase the capacity of a jail by one prisoner.
Equipped with jewel crafting tools to make jewelry.
Outdoor light makes the streets of your settlement safer.
Support for scraping the leather from fur.
Equipment to produce leather clothes and armor.
A place to prepare the delivery of goods.
Steel hooks to hang and store meat.
A shaft to harvest resources hidden deep underground. Requires supply of ropes to function.
Oil-based lamp. Best fit for large halls.
For animals to eat from. Can be filled with straw, acorns, and vegetables.
Used to hang and dry paper.
Mashes rags to turn them into a paper mash.
Filters paper mash into sheets of paper.
Public ceremonies and executions are announced at this stage.
Wooden shelves for storing food and beverages.
Turns yarn into a strong rope.
Holds wood to be cut in planks
A stone platform is great support for sculptors.
Can keep grains, corn, rice and hops.
Simple chair dedicated only to the members of the high council.
A simple chair for the mighty and just.
A smaller barrel with weak construction.
Small pot to grow useful plants.
Small shelves to store food and ingredients.
Used to work on tools and weapons.
Candle with a high stand so it can be placed on the floor.
The most impressive and expensive bench you can find.
Standard chair made out of stone.
Small store for villagers to sell their goods.
Table for tailors to craft clothes.
Pit in the ground filled with lime-based solution to process hides.
Used in the hospital by nurses to tend injuries and bruises.
A stage for actors to gather and perform for the enjoyment of their viewers.
A chair for the mighty and just. Invokes respect to anyone approaching and establishes formal etiquette.
Used to train fighting skill by soldiers.
Spring trap to capture wild animals and impair their movement.
For planting seeds of trees. Trees grow faster in forests.
Supports branches of grapes and hops.
Basic and accessible fence gate from wooden rods.
Wooden rack to store weapons and equipment.
Grinds the grains and turn them into flour.
Wooden bench can host multiple people.
Used to work with stone, ores or wood.
Simple grave with a wooden cross.
Used by scribers to produce writings.
Flower pot for growing decorative plants.
Flower pot for growing decorative plants.
Advanced repair kit is used for structures built by architects.
Farmers take care of sheeps and chickens, foragers breed pigs and stables look after horses.
Requires family with architect profession to be built.
Artisans have more rights and demands. They expect luxurious houses, good meals, and wealthy lifestyle. They will leave if they are unhappy.
Your intelligence officer may perform assassinations to dispose opposing villagers, but if you get uncovered, you might get the opposite effect.
Families arrive as visitors to your inn if there was enough empty beds the previous night. They will spend few nights before making a decision to settle or move on.
Basic repair kit is used for structures built by carpenters.
Decorate houses and build expensive furniture to improve beauty. The beauty overlay gives you information about each location.
Villagers will build your structures automatically if they have the required resources.
Building - perform constructing and deconstructing tasks.
Requires family with carpentry profession to be built.
Regiments marked with cavalry will visit stables and train horse riding on horses equipped with horse saddle and horseshoes.
Master Of Affairs gives you the ability to hold public celebrations to boost mood and happiness of the village.
Establish a church, enlist novices and appoint leaders that will run the clergy to satisfy spiritual needs and gain exclusive goods and services.
Clergy acts as a unified family in the sense that they share all the resources and zones between all members.
Clergy produces meals for all clergy members.
Clergy has two important people that you need to recruit in your council to establish it:
All new members join as novices and become initiated after they learn reading, writing and consecration in the library.
Each villager that could not participate in a Sunday Service will hurt your relationship with the clergy.
The clergy also expects you to perform monetary donations. You will need to donate regularly, otherwise your relationship will decline.
All members of clergy commonly share their resources and structures in all clergy zones and trade on the market to the needs of all.
It is structured into orders where members of each order work in their designated zones. Workers are assigned automatically by clergy but you may set limitations on maximum amount of workers.
The clergy will also demand tax on some vital resources. You can block this tax, but if you do, your relationship with the clergy will decline faster.
Combat skills improve chance of survival in combat or at war. Skills are developed by using the weapon in combat, or by training with a training dummy in the barracks.
Better chairs, benches, or beds will always help to keep your people comfortable.
Consecration - knowledge of the faith. Can be initiated as a monk.

To build advanced structures, families place construction orders at the storefront of the construction family. They need to have enough money for the material and a fee. Once built, they will pay the cost each day.
The blueprint color is darker once the order is placed. All necessary material is purchased by the builders.

If the ordering family has required materials on sale, they will be used in the construction and receive a discount. Offering them for free from your warehouse will only make the builders profit more so make direct donations instead!
Structures are separated to tiers, to indicate who can build them:
Tier can also be recognized by the different colors of blueprints.
Cooking - process ingredients and prepare meals.
Cooks will make meals with ingredients in your warehouse for your family, other servants and military.
Coups are formed by cunning artisans. They need smaller numbers than revolts, and in their outcome they will denounce your rule and seize the power.
Once an opposition forms, you have to find the founder and get rid of them in any way possible - execute them, assassinate them or exile their family.
Gather intelligence on families, to find who is involved, and follow the trail up in the hierarchy. If you are careful, you may also spot the leader doing some suspicious activities.
In the market price list you can force an embargo on trade with caravans. Leverage this option to prevent caravans to supply or export a resource that you do not wish to receive / lose.
When villagers become of old age, they may choose to join the clergy voluntarily. You can also order an adult peasant villager to enlist in the clergy.
Setting an equipment preference will make the person wear it once it is available in your warehouse.
Master Of Law lets you hire an executioner and perform public executions to instill more fear and refrain villagers from crimes.
Families are bound to you by oath. They ask for land and, in exchange, they pay you taxes on their production.
Fealty is a contract between you and the head of the family. Choose the owner and one of the four taxation strategies.
Structures used by the zone are often required to make it fully functional. Villagers will not work if they don't have the required profession and all necessary structures.
Guards occupy guard posts, hunt down criminals nearby, protect your family, and fight dangerous wild animals.
Villagers can cause themselves injuries during combat or when performing manual labor. Sickness is known to spread from travelers, or when villagers are enduring harsh weather.
Appoint members of the high council to unlock new ruling actions and receive various bonuses.
Build a villa and invite one of the noble houses to live there. They will expect excellent meals, a beautifull villa and sufficient heating.
These needs are of particular importance to artisans, peasants may accept ignoring them.
In order to proceed with the initiation, each novice must study required skills at the library.
Light injuries heal by themselves. Severe health conditions make villagers stay in bed and isolate in the hospital. Serious health conditions may even kill them.
All villagers will visit inn if they have no available meals or ability to cook them.
Master Of Affairs lets you hire an intelligence officer to investigate families and gather vital information.
Jailers monitor the jail and make sure all prisoners are fed.
Doing well on taxes improves your relationship and gain valuable favor. Reaching lowest relationship will lose you the land!
After collectors take what they need from your warehouse, your performance is evaluated and you will receive targets for the next year.
Labourers handle basic construction, manage resources and temperature in your manor and other public areas.
Most structures required maintenance for various costs:
Master Of Coin improves your accounting so that with each delivery you are earning bigger rewards and contributing higher value of taxes.
Variety of ingredients is required to cook meals of better quality.
Various regiments dictate responsibilities of each soldier:
After few years royalty may request soldiers as part of the tax.
To meet the requirements, you must send regiments to war before the next autumn with a combat power that adds up to the desired value.
If you equip them with one of the listed pieces of equipment, the combat power they contribute to the goal is increased.
Villagers use different currencies for trade with the following ratio:
Morale reflects the happiness of members in military and servant groups. Soldiers also demand fair pay where most of the money is sent to support their family.
Happiness of villagers is primarily driven by their needs. Keep in mind that making everyone happy does not have to be your goal!
Simple constructions do not require any repair kit for maintenance.

Relationships with nobles decreases over time, so reach out to diplomatic actions in order to maintain them. When positive, you may propose marraige to them and they will occasionally send you gifts. If negative, they may retaliate and hurt your relationship with the royals.
If nobles are unhappy in your settlement, they may become motivated to challenge your clergy donations.

Satisfied nobles will only seek to maintain a positive relationship and will rarely have ambitions to compete with you. However, if your donations are too high for them to compete, they will rather leave.
Noble houses live in their own settlements and grow their wealth independently. You may interact with them in diplomatic actions.
When your people are unhappy and have a bad relationship with you, they become increasingly likely to form oppositions.
You control everything they own, and they will accept poor living conditions though it won't make you very popular.
Use the soil quality overview to display the quality in the location. Nearby water improves the base soil quality.
Good ruler reputation improves happiness of everyone. They want to feel safe and secure in their lives and know that they can trust you.
Unable to sell all that has been offered
All that has been offered has been sold
Prices fluctuate daily based on how all sellers of that resources are managing consistently each day, accounting for reserves and other trends of income:
Zone priority allows you to adjust the ratio between the produced resources.

Villagers learn professions from their family over time, as they perform tasks, making them faster and more efficient. If another family member has a higher profession level than theirs, they will learn faster.
Villagers will stop production if they deem it will not be profitable. This can create supply chain issues, so leverage your option to force them to it in the market price list whenever necessary.
Bishop lets you leverage good relationship with clergy to perform propaganda. Your reputation may increase or decrease depending on the outcome.
If you decide to execute a criminal, you will induce fear and reduce criminality in the following days, but also hurt your reputation.
With a functional town hall and appointed master of affairs is possible to hold weekly public hearings. Your people will request various decisions and favors.
In general accepting will improve your relationship and reputation. Refusing will do otherwise. You can also delay the decision for later, but if you take too long, it will be noticed!
Set up a loading site and complete deliveries to earn extra rewards. You can also send your custom delivery as a gift.
Reading - can read books and be appointed to important positions.
Recruits are the default regiment for all new recruits with no responsibilities.
The soil quality is depleted by crops and trees planted near the location. Having rain or leaving the land empty allows it to regenerate.
Manage percentage that villagers should keep empty.
Families produce meals for all of their members.
To remove structure, use different tools if the blueprint has been already built or not.
Each family forms an opinion of you based on your tax policy, donation, living conditions, and how happy they can be. Combined reputation of each family forms your overall reputation.
Soldiers requested for the war also have specific equipment. Make sure the preferences match and the soldiers are wearing it when they leave for battle.
In case of conflict, the highlighted zone is prioritized!
To quickly switch between edited zones, use the edit button on the zone select mode.
All resources are either gathered from the area or produced by villagers from other resources.
Revolts are formed by peasants. They need to grow in significant numbers and once they do, they will attempt a revolution. Your guards will only protect you, if you have been paying them well.
Recruit stablehand servants and build stables so that you can acquire animals yourself.
You can also purchase, sell, seize or donate animals from or to other families.
Servants (cooks) make meals for the ruling family, other servants and military.
Villagers may perform criminal acts when they are unhappy.
Observing art, statues or visiting theatre replenishes this need.
Once criminal is put in jail, they get a default sentence based on the seriousness of their crime. Changing the length of it may improve or damage relationship with their family.
Recruited peasants can be allocated to different servant work groups:
Your servants lose connection to their family and rely on you for survival.
Your villagers will also use the beds and eat meals there, if they can't provide their own.
When there is no other option
Skills can't be improved once learned. Some skills are acquired automatically when villagers reach adulthood. Others must be studied in the library.
Socializing can occur randomly when someone is close. Villagers also seek to spend time in the pub to socialize.
When royalty requests soldiers, only those with a fully matching equipment who are trained with their weapon will be counted towards the tax payment.
Soldiers train for battle with their preferred equipment and can be sent to war when royalty requests them.
Stablehands feed, groom, equip and take care of all animals in your ownership.
Villagers like to feel wealthy. Build them big houses filled with expensive furniture and keep taxes low.
Appointing generals and blessing soldiers at the altar improves their chances of survival.
If they use a taxed resource (yarn) to produce another taxed resource (silk), they deduct a portion of the consumed yarn from the taxes. You may prevent this in the zone priority section.
If you reassign a zone to a different family, the tax debt will be transferred as well. Removing zone from a storage area will take away resources from the family, but will not decrease their debt.
War veteran skill is given to soldiers that survived a battle.
Woodcutting - cut down trees, remove obstacles and make firewood.
Writing - transcribing manuscripts. Needed for important positions.
Study in the library. Needs paper.
Zones can be placed from the build menu. Moving mouse over the zone gives you detailed information.
Currently edited zone is highlighted with white border. All tiles of each zone must connect on the borders!
Zones are plot of lands that can be assigned to a family and used to manage taxation.
Study in the library. Needs manuscripts.
Study in the library. Needs manuscripts.
Wall made out of bricks and mortar.
It grows all year long! Is it magic?
Made from a mixture of clay and wooden rods.
Made out of stacks of hay.
Limestone processed into a moldable quicklime.
Gorgeously decorated fence from a strong material.

Villagers will purchase, tame and breed animals in desired ratio of sex until they reach the limitations set in the priority options of the zone.
Reading and writing are a necessity for all members of the artisans class. They will seek to study them in the library, and if they will not be able to, your relationship will suffer.
Resource can only be purchased if the seller has open storefront and they desire to sell the resources themselves.
Caravans will only arrive, if you have an empty storefront and caravan storage. They will mostly bring resources that are demanded by your villagers and are lacking critical supply.
Chickens will lay eggs in their bed. Owners let fertile eggs to hatch until they reach the animal zone limits.
To quickly switch to a removal tool, hold the removal mode button while placing a blueprint
You can adjust target ratios of planted crops in the priority menu of the zone.
Crops are influenced by seasons and the soil quality of the location. Higher quality means faster growth and smaller chance to get sick
Feefarm can be seen as monetary rent. If you have no interest in the resources, money is the next best thing.
Villagers will use the ingredients that the assigned animal eats. Some animals can also peck the ground or eat wild grass.
Frankalmoigne is a generous policy where no taxation is demanded. This is mandatory for all clergy zones.
Donating resources can often solve economic problems. It can take some time before they are transferred by your servants.
Villagers can also live inside labor zones so households are optional, but it can be useful to separate their living area.
Your villagers will cook food if you build cooking tables, wells, cauldrons, wood blocks to make firewood and secure variety of ingredients.
The inn attracts new visitors. A better ruler reputation and quality of the inn improve the chances for visitors to request settling. Visitors only arrive if there are empty beds the previous night.
The royalty requests taxes every autumn and gives you a year to deliver a certain value of resources of your choice. You may also deliver them via optional quests for extra rewards.
Every rooftop needs to be supported by nearby walls or mountains. If you can't place a new one, try building some walls first.
Seizing resources hurts your relationship, but it may sometimes be necessary. Consider purchasing the resources instead.
If you undercut the market price, villagers will prioritize you regardless of distance.
Socage pays by percentage accounted when the resource is produced. Villagers may spend taxed resources in order to make a different taxed resource or in order to survive.
Stewardry prevents keeping any produced resources. Donate them what they need or give them decent pay to buy it themselves.
Lack of storage will lead to trashpiles which makes the area less beautiful.
Villagers use storefronts to sell goods. They always occupy only one closest storefront and will prioritize storefront inside of their zone over one in the marketplace.
Place structures strategically. Learn about the production chain and put connected professions close to reduce times for walking.
Structures can only be accessed via their access points and villagers can only use structures within their own or public zones.

Villagers will pay you taxes according to their zone fealty at the end of each season. They will always do their best to pay as much as they are supposed to. Then they collect the gold they are entitled to from the stewardry zones.
Clothes improve temperature tolerance. Villagers will also heat up by any nearby heat sources. Build better walls and roofs to increase insulation of rooms.
Villagers can sleep on the ground, but even a basic bed will go a long way to make them happier.
Your warehouse stores everything you own and tax from your villagers so make sure to always have one!
Assigning zone grants access to resources and structures in the area. Owners will use the structures to perform their profession.
Removing a zone causes owning families to lose access to everything within the area.
How much gold and food that new families arrive with
The average maximum weight of goods the caravans arrive with
How long it takes before another caravan visits your settlement
How likely will villagers commit crimes with respect to their happiness
How much your reputation will suffer when you exile a family
How much your reputation impacts villagers likelihood to settle
How long it takes for prices to reach their maximum or minimum price, when the market is out of balance
How quickly grass turns into clay as a result of villagers walking over it
How likely will villagers conceive or adopt a child
The amount of time that is increased to execute tasks due to a low level of a required profession
How much your family relationship will suffer when you seize something  from a family
How fast soil degrades and requires time to regenerate
How likely will crops get sick due to the low quality of the soil
How many resources that you start with
How fast structures degrade and require repair
The relative value of resources requested by the royals for taxation
How long it takes for villagers to freeze or overheat
How quickly terrain spreads and changes
How long it takes to perform productive tasks
How quickly trees and other vegetation spreads
How long it takes for villagers to become unhappy due to the deprivation of their needs
How long it takes before another family visits your settlement
Villagers need your permission to keep an animal. Any animal obtained above the limit will be sold to other villagers who have an interest in buying them.
Pigs are raised by foragers inside the forest. All animal owners seek to maintain a good ratio between males and females, so they breed them efficiently.
New domesticated animals are regularly sold by caravans. Build their marketplace so villagers can start purchasing them.
Once an animal reaches a certain age, butchers will be interested in buying them for slaughter. Butchers will also buy any animal carcass, including corpses of wild animals.
Before we get started, you will certainly need the services of carpenters. I have sent you a family to help you.
This is quite the economy you are growing here! Keep going, I will soon give you more opportunities to prove yourself.

Hunters can help with a steady supply of animals for butchering. A forest feeder will attract herds of wild animals and the hideout offers them longer sight and protection from animals that retaliate.
You should also familiarize yourself with soil quality. Each plant or a nearby tree will drain nutrition and slow down growth. Leaving a certain portion of the soil empty helps it regenerate.

Villagers who produce resources are always interested in storing what they make in the nearest storage so they can get back to work as soon as possible. Other villagers then regularly relocate resources where they are meant to be according to the storage priority.

Unlike regular peasants, artisans enjoy more rights. They can leave the settlement if they are unhappy, and are more sensitive to the quality of their household and the food they eat. Use better furniture for their houses.
Your villagers always appreciate a little bit of fun. Pick a date, a public area to celebrate in and a catering family to supply the celebration bar to make extra profit.
Other positions of the High Council will become useful later. Now develop your settlement further and make sure your duties to the crown are paid on time.
Establish your High Council to perform special ruling ceremonies. You can assign your family members, or any of the artisans to improve your relationship with them.
If you wish to attract artisans to your village, your manor should speak for itself. Make sure it looks wealthy!
You should also appoint a Master of Coin. Their services will optimize your tax policies and improve the value of your deliveries.
A public park will surely be a great place for some celebrations. I am sure a town like this will greatly benefit from one.
Actors can provide great entertainment for all of your villagers and make them happier. A little distraction can go a long way.
To expand this monastery, you will need the help of architects. I am sending you a family that can help.

In order to grant clergy jurisdiction in the area, it is your responsibility to appoint a bishop and minister from the ranks of monks. They are the main representatives of the clergy and hold Sunday Mass.
While other villagers attend the church for a Sunday mass of the minister, nobles like you enjoy a more private experience in the chapel held by the bishop.
Clergy will observe your actions and maintain a reputation with you. To keep it positive, observe the advice of the clergy and make donations to their satisfaction.

Recruits join the clergy as novices. To be promoted to monks by the minister, they need to know reading, writing and consecration. They can study them in the library, but it will consume manuscripts and paper.
While novices are studying to be promoted to monks, let's make sure they do not run out of food. I am sending you a family of farmers that can support them.
In the absence of a graveyard, villagers will bury their loved ones in their own households. Graveyard keepers will keep the graves clean and maintain them on their behalf.
Very well! I am pleased with your efforts here. I shall leave you to it now. When I need your services again, I will be sure to contact you.
Establish your presence with a worthy manor. Feel free to leverage the services of architects to achieve an oustanding effect.
Monks can be assigned to work groups that perform specific tasks in the related clergy zones. Paper, in particular, is made from rags that are donated by villagers when they wear out old clothes.
When your relationship with the clergy is positive, you can leverage their influence to boost your ruling reputation.

To expand the clergy, you can command peasants to join it. Some of them will join voluntarily when they reach an older age. This decision is sacred and you may not reverse it. I am awarding you extra favor in case you need to request a family to recruit from.
Perhaps having a jail is the first sign for these criminals that there are going to be consequences. Make sure it gets built quickly.
A strong leader does not simply rule with a strong hand but also listens to the people. Build a city hall so you can hold regular public hearings.
Public execution leaves fear in the hearts of many. It shall make you unpopular yet feared and respected. In desperate times, desperate actions are the only way to move forward.
Execution is not supposed to simply punish lost souls. It is to send a message. A public spectacle for everyone to see and remember.
The people of this town are far from saved from their criminal past, but they are on a good path. I believe your continued presence in this land will serve them well.
The closer a criminal gets to an occupied guard post, the better chance they are spotted. Guards can be expensive so make protecting your warehouse the highest priority.
Guards are operating guard posts and catching criminals. Jailors are watching over the jail and feeding the criminals food. Night guards will adjust their schedule to sleep during the day.
You don't have to wait for the guards to capture a criminal. You rule this land and it is your right to jail whoever you please. Serve justice well.
In order to hold a public hearing, your town hall must have a throne and a speaking table, and your Master of Affairs must be appointed.
Appointing a Master of Law is necessary to carry out an execution. All executions must be rooted in a case of law and it is in their jurisdiction to ratify them.
Appointing a Master of Law is necessary to carry out an execution. All executions must be rooted in a case of law and it is in their jurisdiction to ratify them.
To cook meals, they need firewood, cauldron, cooking table and well. Wooden block can be used to cut wood into firewood.
Villagers can cook their own meals too. In your personal kitchen, you can cook meals of higher quality, but more on that later.
Visitors will only arrive if you have a few unoccupied beds and a bar at the inn.
The inn will also serve your locals. If they don't have enough food or their own bed, they will pay the inn for the bed and meals.
The inn should be rather large, as it will host many visitors. The farmers are a big family so they should be able to take care of it alongside their farm.
Farmers will help sustain your family but also provide ingredients for the inn.
Good work, but it will take more to make it livable. See to it that it can suit your family’s needs.
Seems like you are ready to welcome new guests. Make sure your inn has enough empty beds so they keep coming!
Now that you have a place to live, it is time to think of your peasants. I have sent you a family of farmers to sustain your needs. Build them a house and don't forget walls and a roof!
Visitors should be coming soon now! In the meantime, I have sent a family of foragers to help you with the supply of firewood.
As you can see, the building was quite damaged. Use the salvaged material to repair it.
Not much has been left behind here. See if you can salvage some resources out of this old manor.
Peasants will typically try to cook normal meals, which need a supply of two different ingredients, like vegetables and meat.
Now create a zone for the manor from the land that is left.
Villagers keep detailed accounting about their production. This can give you insight into the balance of supply and demand.
This town will need a lot of newcomers to revitalize the economy. Decide which family is the best fit for running the inn.
Start by building a centralized marketplace. Storefronts that you build there will be used by peasants who don't have a storefront in their own zone.
If a supplier has only a few customers that purchase irregularly, there is no need for them to come to the marketplace, so make sure they have their own storefront.
Unfortunately, your supplies are not limitless. For a more sustainable solution, you need to build a caravan marketplace.

The market will change prices every morning. Villagers use their experience to predict if their stock will decrease over time. If they think it will, they increase the price. In a balanced economy, prices always recover to their standard price.
Caravans will also buy from villagers if the price is reasonable. Export embargoes can be a useful tool to prevent losing an important resource or manipulate supply and demand.
If the cost of material is higher than the product, villagers will stop producing it until the market recovers. You can force them to produce it even if they lose money on it.

Villagers try to balance their stock to suit their needs, but they will prioritize profit over extra safety. Farmers with a lot of food will not hold onto it in fear of troubling times when there is money to be made now.
You should be familiar with the basics of trading. Keep trading with caravans, grow the settlement and maintain a balanced economy. I trust that you won't fail.
Every time villagers buy something from caravans, money will leave your economy. This might not always align with your goals, so use import embargo where needed.
You can also offer some resources for free. This is especially good when you want to allow easy access to materials to help with construction projects.
One way to alleviate the supply issue is to offer goods from your own stock. Anyone who needs them will trade with you, as long as your price is better than the market price.
You can also trade with caravans yourself! Buy resources that your settlement needs to build reserves, or sell excess resources to build your treasury.
You can also set priorities on production for each family. For example, to make three wood planks for each unit of wood produced. Setting priority to zero will have them ignore the resource fully.
If you anticipate a shortage of demand, limit the maximum stock they should keep. You can also have them maintain higher reserves of material to improve their efficiency.
Caravans arrive every few days, as long as there is an empty storefront and caravan storage that they can reserve.
In order to contribute to your royal duties, you need to send regiments to battle. Regiments that have a general appointed increase their military power.
All military efforts start with barracks. They can house your soldiers and provide them with training grounds to hone their fighting skills.
Weapons and quality armor require craft of the highest honor. I am sending you a reputable family of blacksmiths. House them well!
Horses are hard to get by, so not all regiments will be able to train with them. It is up to you to decide which regiments are assigned to the cavalry.
In times of war keeping our faith strong is even more important. Dedicate some time to establishing the presence of the clergy.
Good work. Now prepare yourself. There are great conflicts ahead and soon I will require your contribution to the army so train your soldiers well.
When recruiting to the military, it is wise to first consider those who are the least useful to the economy.
Ministers can share their blessings at the altar which bolsters your soldiers and helps them survive a battle. If you wish for your soldiers to participate, give them an order.

Soldiers will consume meals from your warehouse, but to keep their morale high, you need to offer them decent pay. Most of it will go to support their family if it does not fill the pockets of the bartender.
Soldiers are part of a regiment and will wear and train with the equipment that they are assigned. They will always use the equipment from your warehouse.
If an animal that is not owned by anyone ends up dying inside of an unassigned zone, it falls to your possession and your stablehands will bring it to the knackery.
Stables can house all animals that end up in your possession, especially horses. They are tended by stablehands so assign some servants to them.
Before you send regiments to war, you also need to appoint a marshal to your high council. Now send me as many soldiers as you can.
Stone is a delicate material and requires very skilled builders to use it for construction. Architects provide construction services for those advanced blueprints.
With access to smelters, you can leverage dig sites to harvest clay from the ground. It is wise to reduce the priority of foragers so they stop gathering clay rocks in the forest.

Since you are prospering well, in accordance with the law I shall start demanding contributions henceforth. My requests always arrive in autumn and you will have one year to complete them so keep an eye out for them.
This colony will contribute great value to our realm. Keep making sure it is growing and your responsibilities are met well.
There used to be only the prospectors who relied on supplies from caravans. If we want to grow, we need something more sustainable. I am sending you a family of farmers to help you with produce.
Developing this colony is not going to be easy and you will stay here for a while. I believe a proper manor now takes priority.
The mining zone determines the area that a family is allowed to mine from. I am sending you another family of miners, to expedite the process, but do not hesitate to accept more.
If you ever need a particular family, you may request what you need and I shall see to it there is someone to help you. You can gain more favor by meeting your royal duties.
Resources are also underground, as you can see in the underground richness map. Any mineshaft will progressively mine out from the shaft to a certain distance.
Your relationship with nobles always declines over time, so maintain it regularly. If you don't, they may choose to leverage their influence and weaken your standing with the crown.
As much as I am in favor of your glory, the influence of nobles can be strong and I must respect their wish. I sincerely hope you succeed in earning their recognition.
As long as you treat them well, the family will be happy to stay for a whole season. If you fail to satisfy them, your relationship will suffer greatly.
If you want to have guests, it is very important to serve them good meals. Make sure your kitchen is well supplied with a large variety of ingredients.
Status is everything for nobles. Build yourself a manor that will leave them in  awe.
Hosting a noble family at your villa is a great way to impress them. They expect high-quality furniture, a beautiful villa and good meals to be served at all times.
Getting rid of the leader will set the uprising back a few steps, but there is always someone else waiting to step in. Stay vigilant.
Once you pick a family for investigation, the intelligence officer will follow them and collect valuable information for you. This can prove vital in discovering an uprising.
There is no time to waste. Appoint a Master of Affairs to your High Council and employ an Intelligence Officer so you can carry out investigations.

Simple structures are quite straightforward and can be done by anyone, but advanced woodwork requires a specialized family of carpenters. They will accept construction orders for a price, obtain the material and build what is needed.
Your servants will need a place to lay their heads for sleep. Build them a small cottage, somewhere close to your manor.
As always, you should not forget to build a sizable inn. If you wish to make it more beautiful, invite carpenters and construct furniture and walls of a higher quality.
The kitchen is an area dedicated only to your servants where they can prepare meals for your family, servants and anyone else directly under you.

Carpenters charge for any materials they have to buy and a fee for their labor. They will use the material of the ordering family, but only if it was there at the time of order. For this reason, any construction material you want to donate should be given to the builder family directly.
You are breathing life into this place like I never could before. Well done. Continue with your efforts, I shall contact you again soon.

Winter can get cold so always be sure to build proper housing. Closed walls, a roof and a source of heat such as a campfire or fireplace will do. Stock up on firewood as well to keep the fires going all winter.

Glass can be a very good export item for the caravans, but surely useful to decorate your manor as well. Expensive decorations can improve the beauty and leave villagers satisfied. Nobles are particularly sensitive to it.
Public areas are shared spaces for everyone. It can serve as a nice park, but also to share campfires or to build wells, if you want to deny them the luxury of a private one.
In times of desperation, you can also seize materials directly. Unlike taxes, the effect is immediate, but it is seen as a violent act by the villagers and will damage your relationship.
Families and servants always maintain stock of meals based on the amount of family members but you can set for them your own goals.
There are some supplies that you may use to start the settlement. The rest is in your hands. Good luck.
You have gathered a lot of favor for your deeds. Use it now to request families to settle with. Farmers and foragers could be essential to get a good start.
Now assign a tenure to a household for each family. Assign it under frankalmoign, meaning the use of the land will be free of charge.
Villagers will sleep on the ground if they have to, but will not be very happy about it. Couples also need double beds if you want to see their family grow.
Farmers can produce large quantities of food. Make sure the farm is big enough but not bigger than what the family can effectively handle.
Fishing nets will capture fish automatically, but will regularly cost material to maintain.
A roof will provide protection from the rain and it also helps during winter to capture heat inside the building.
A chair and table allow them to eat comfortably, but also to share a common time together, so they don't feel lonely and isolated.
Your warehouse stores all of the resources you own. Be careful when modifying it as your settlement can not run without it! Now close the zone overview.
Now that they own the land, they are responsible for taking care of it, including construction inside the zone. They will also need to be given materials for building.
Your villagers need to be productive! Specialized zones can only be managed by families who are knowledgeable in the required profession.
Productive zones can be taxed with socage. Villagers will set the required portion aside, and pay it to you at the end of the season.
Each family needs a place to live. Select the household zone and mark the area. A decent household requires at least 10x10 acres.
Foragers will automatically replant the trees they cut, but you can create tree spots to plant more.
Without food, your villagers will starve. Use the "How To" button in your goals menu to get guidance on granting them food from your stock.
Now that your villagers are productive, stay a while to make sure everything is right. You can also accommodate a new family of farmers.
Let's first look around here. Move the camera with your keyboard.
Villagers form families that interact with you and lease land from you in exchange for taxes. Familiarize yourself with the population of this settlement.
Zone overview will help you manage the land divisions. You can toggle it with your keyboard or buttons in the menu.
If you need to slow down and take a break, use the space button to stop the time completely.
When managing your food supply, pay attention to which crops can grow in which season.
Press the buttons on your keyboard or use the buttons below the clock to make time run faster.
Every resource has a designated storage structure. Order your villagers to build storage spaces for their produce.
Now that your villagers are productive, wait for the end of the season for their taxes to become due. While waiting, feel free to accommodate a new family of farmers.
To get a better overview, zoom in and out with your mouse wheel.
Clergy can also produce a vital cure that can support the recovery of patients. Build an apothecary and grow wild plants to produce cures.
To build a proper hospital, you will need the help of carpenters first.
A hospital can also treat minor injuries and wounds with bandages and salve. Do your best to save as many lives as you can.
When dealing with an epidemic, it is critical to have a hospital ready. Sick villagers can isolate there and prevent sickness from spreading further.
Hospitals are tended by nurses from the clergy. Appoint a sufficient amount to their post.
Each morning villagers attempt to buy what they need and reflect on what they can sell. In this way, the bakery will rely on a supply of flour from the windmill.
The inn can also serve beverages. Not only does it make you more money from tourists, but the locals can also satisfy their social needs.
The Inn is operating a small farm, but if we want to grow this land, it will not suffice. A new family of farmers should be reaching you now.

Your reputation is an outcome of the relationships you maintain with each family. Generally, if the family is doing well, your relationship will improve. You can also improve it by granting them resources.
Build more beds to make space for visitors. You can also consider forbidding the Inn from serving the locals.
This town is growing well thanks to your efforts. Now make sure this potential is fully realized.

A successful supply chain requires that villagers have enough money to trade with and the supply is balanced with the demand. They might sell taxed resources too, but only if they get desperate for income.
There is no need for you to sleep at the inn. Since you have just arrived here, it is only wise to develop a small manor for yourself first.
Villagers do not have to rely on your generosity to get by. If you build storefronts on their land, they will occupy them and trade with each other.
You can view what they want to sell and buy in their accounting book. They update this information every morning.
The wealth of your settlement is updated every morning. It represents the current market value of all resources and structures in your settlement. To increase it, your villagers must produce more.
Some of the visitors will request to stay rather than leave. The better your reputation is as a ruler in this town, the more inclined they are to do so.

The vast forests and sprawling wildlife that are to be found here present great opportunities for all kinds of foraging and hunting. Now that they no longer serve me as royal hunting grounds, it is time that you exploit them for the benefit of the realm.

I have called upon all hunters from afar to venture and kneel before your might to offer their skills in your service. May they serve you well on your task.

With pleasure in my heart, I am glad to see that your travels were safe. You have built quite the renown for yourself and I must implore you to be vigilant. With great power comes also a great number of enemies.

Now, for this task, you must master the art of trade and attract the interest of artisans - citizens wealthy enough to enjoy freedoms beyond those of mere peasants. You might find their services vital or at the very least, entertaining.

This monastery has been long secluded from other settlements and relied on the tithe contributions to sustain their needs. With your efforts to revitalize the region, they have seen a number of new faithful souls seeking refuge and devotion.

Take advantage of their motivation and put it to good use. This monastery has a lot of potential and I believe it can be a great beacon of faith for our people.

Month after month I have been receiving reports of the truly declined and abhorrent situation this town is finding itself in. Numerous murders, vandalism, and theft are raging rampant. Guards are nonexistent and various criminal groups are taking advantage of our negligence and believe they can act above the law.

It is time to end this unacceptable insult to the crown. Strive to protect and execute any who believe to doubt your dedication to reclaim order. May you rule with resolve and just.

The manor in this long-forgotten land, once scarred by an ancient war, is a sad sight for anyone to see. I do not wish for it to end this way, so it is now your responsibility to breathe new life into its desolation. Prepare yourself, for the word shall spread afar, sparking curiosity in the hearts of many who shall seek to visit this place once more.

You must build an Inn capable of hosting them so that this region may grow and prosper. Handle this task with utmost diligence and ensure its success.

The time and situation at hand require your utmost attention. A devastating plague has tarnished this region, leaving many struggling to proceed with their trade as they are now unable to get the supplies they have grown reliant on.

In order to improve local trade, I ask you to construct a central marketplace and establish support for caravans to import their goods. Act swiftly, as their morale is already diminishing.

I have selected this settlement for you as it can serve you well in raising your army. Local folks have been supplying weapons and armor of great quality for many years, but more will be required of them now.

Build barracks and recruit soldiers. Train them well and arm them. Be prepared as I will soon request your contribution to the war. May your reign be glorious.

An incredible richness these vast mountains have been hiding from us. No more my magnificent noble. The gold and silver that we found here have the potential to finance our war chest.

It is of the utmost importance that you develop the mining colony and exploit these lands quickly and efficiently. In accordance with the law, I shall now demand proceeds from your settlement every year. May your rule be glorious.

Your story is truly inspiring. From a noble claim over an insignificant plot of land, your service to the crown earned you the office of regency only a few years later. You must celebrate this great honor.

Do not rest for too long, however. High nobility all around the realm will now judge your character. I trust you that your diplomacy will not fail. Our kingdom is held by a delicate balance of power, and I shall not tolerate any attempts to dissolve it.

Since the outbreak of the war, some vassals chose to betray me and side with the enemy, much like a previous lord of this town. Should his foresight be as high as his ambition, he might be still among us. Not all agree with my decision, however. A number of loyalists are rumored to scheme against the crown.

It is now up to you to uncover this treason and deal with it accordingly. Establish a council and hold meetings. Appoint a Master of Affairs and investigate. And above all, be vigilant. Some of them may choose to take matters into their own hands.

I no longer have a need for this estate. My servants have been maintaining it as is their duty, though my occasional visits can not justify their labor. I hereby name you the lord of this land and transition my servants under your guidance.

Take the time to settle yourself and establish your foothold. I shall soon reach out to you with more pressing matters so you can put your magnificent talent to good use.

These vast lands present a great opportunity for our people. Establish a settlement, grow its wealth and glory and build a name and renown of your house that will reach the ears of many.

This is no easy task and your work will be long, but it is of the utmost importance that you succeed. I fully trust your skills and expect that you will do everything you can to succeed. May a fortune guide you.

I write to you with immense pleasure to announce that you have been entrusted with the governance of this uninhabited land. This opportunity is a testament to your potential and I believe it will serve as a defining moment for you to prove your worthiness.

I urge you to settle and develop the land. Rest assured, I shall provide guidance along this journey. However, I expect you to rely on your inherent wisdom in tackling this endeavor. May you flourish and bring honor to our realm.

As you can see, this plague is taking its toll in great numbers. People reportedly fall sick within days, and the local church, unfortunately, can not offer any more than prayers.

Establish a hospital and treat these people as fast as you can. Time is of the essence, as every day more lives are lost. May your faith be strong.

This task will surely prove to be an honorable challenge for you. Unfortunately, this region has been performing poorly. Occupied by a single inn that has failed to report any significant taxes for several years. Owners claim that this place has been rumored to be dangerous and travelers are hesitant to spend time there.

I trust in your skills to improve the settlement, ensure its growth, and dispel any lingering concerns. Do not disappoint me.

The numerous supply of meat we are now able to get is certainly going to be of great use for the numerous celebrations and noble banquets the royal court must entertain.

Reflecting on your success, I wish to appoint you personally to be in charge of a new mining colony, that our prospectors have recently discovered. I shall expect your arrival once you are able to.

Let it be known to any who doubt your abilities and competence that their faith is misplaced and ill-gotten. Your wit knows no bounds and your service to the realm is exceptional.

With great disdain, I must admit that our diplomacy is failing and a great conflict is imminent. I request you to train regiments to aid me. Dark times are upon our realm.

One of the high-ranking members of the Clergy informed me that your influence over the monastery was truly beneficial and expressed humbling gratitude for your efforts. I am pleased to hear this, as only the most faithful and humble of souls can tackle my next task.

Plague is once again strangling our nation, though this time, perhaps not all is lost. Recruit the most skilled healers in the monastery and travel quickly to offer your aid.

I am truly relieved that you handled this situation well. It may have cost some lives, but those are difficult times and difficult times require difficult decisions.

Since your experience in enforcing the law is above many, I wish you to serve me on my next task. There are rumors in a nearby town of a potential uprising. Depart immediately as this matter may prove to be critical for our realm.

I extend my warmest congratulations on renovating this magnificent manor. You have truly revitalized this region and I commend your efforts. I never imagined this barren land could see such lively townsfolk again.

Your skill and competence are exemplary and I am pleased to see that you are serving your realm well. However, do not dwell on your success. There are other regions that could use your direction and I expect you to depart quickly.

Your competence and dedication to our realm continue to excel. Many settlements do not survive such a tragic fate, but you have made a difference. Folk now surely honor your name with songs and praise as they celebrate your success.

Perhaps your family deserves the recognition of a higher renown. To reward your efforts, I grant you the claim over one of my humble estates. I expect to welcome you there soon.

You have served me well my reverent noble. The soldiers you have trained will ensure the survival of our realm and secure my glory as the uncontested and only rightful successor to the throne.

The war is going to be long, so I will continue to require your contributions. Now travel afar, where the influence of the royal crown grows weak. Many have gone the path of evil and they need to be reminded of what values our kingdom stands to protect.

I am very pleased with your contributions to the royal treasury. With these proceeds, we can be very confident in the strength of our realm.

Indeed, your actions have not gone unnoticed. Clergy too has heard of your glorious endeavors and requested your presence in a nearby monastery. I believe you will not keep them waiting.

Missives and in-person notice have reached me from many noble houses that they recognize your claim and stand by the crown in appointing your excellence to serve the realm as its regent.

Good news has also reached us from the front. Our enemies have been captured and forced to capitulate. In order to establish the influence of the crown, I have but a last request to implore you. Take as many supplies as you need and establish a new settlement to spread the glory of our nation.

Well done my magnificent noble. Your swift action allowed you to restore the faith of the citizens in the crown, and prevent further misfortunes. I shall organize a banquet in your name to honor your noble and glorious service.

With pleasure and joy, I wish to share with you my intention to recognize you as a royal regent of the southern lands. Surely other noble houses of similar renown will now take notice. Expect soon their diplomatic attempts to reach you.

Well done! I sincerely congratulate you on establishing such a magnificent manor. I have full confidence that your house will be just and prosper under your leadership.

This manor used to serve as my hunting lodge. There is a forest nearby famously bountiful on prey. I implore it to be of interest to visit it and take advantage of its yields.

I would never imagine witnessing such unprecedented growth. Your contribution to the crown is truly exemplary.

I must admit I have become personally invested in your journey over the years. You have consistently and without rest exceeded expectations and I am honored to appoint regency over these lands to someone of such a high nobility.

I have no more pressing matters for you at this moment, though I believe you will find the opportunities to exploit the richness of these lands to remain plentiful.

May your house rule with unquestionable glory and magnificence.

I extend my congratulations for your accomplishments in successfully developing the settlement to my liking. Your dedication and undeniable potential have garnered my admiration.

In light of your achievements, I have deemed it fitting to entrust you with greater responsibilities. I hereby request your presence in another land, where new challenges await your capable leadership.

What you have achieved here is nothing short of a miracle. Praise be your might and glory for aiding those people and saving many innocent lives.

For now, we need to focus on growing our realm further. One of the villages in your region has the potential to transform into a town of strong significance. Once you reach it, I shall inform you of your duties.

News has reached me that the region under your charge is brimming with opportunities, attracting workers from all places in search of a new life. How inspiring it is to witness such potential.


I am eager to see if your skills in trade are equally competent. There is a nearby settlement grappling with severe supply chain issues. I implore you to depart promptly to address this dire situation.

Artisans are a wealthier working class. They expect better furniture and have the freedom to leave the settlement if they are unhappy.
You can study the construction stage and what is needed for progression by clicking on each blueprint. You can also manually prioritize it to override the automatic system.
Constructions must be placed inside a zone and the zone must be assigned to a family in order for them to build it. All other construction is handled by the ruling family.
Pay attention to the color of the blueprints. White indicates that it can be built by anyone. Blue is for carpenters and orange is for architects. A darker tint reflects that it has been ordered.

Villagers generally prioritize higher-quality meals first. In order to cook them, they need to have access to ingredients from a certain number of categories. You can study those in the knowledge book.
Monitor the debuffs in your HUD for information about critical conditions and modifiers that are taking effect in your settlement.

The Zone menu can be opened by clicking on the zone area. If you are currently editing zone layouts (a blue background), you need to first cancel it with the cancel action (ESC). The currently edited zone is highlighted with a white border.

Monks are initiated either by a bishop or the ruling family in case there is none. Novices must know reading, writing and consecration, which they can study in the library using paper and manuscripts. They are initiated every Sunday during the Sunday Mass.

Military Power is composed of the health, equipment, skills, blessing and cavalry bonus of each soldier in the regiment. If a soldier wears equipment that is currently listed as bonus equipment, the contributed power is increased for each piece of equipment.

Unhappy villagers are inclined to join the revolutionaries if they come in contact with one of them. As they grow they form a hierarchy of leadership. Investigate families and follow the trail until you discover the founder.
Selecting zone in the menu will automatically switch to the edit zone overlay. Zones can have any shape but all of its tiles must be directly connected.
Study the required structures of each zone and the recipes of each production structure to learn how different professions tie into each other.
Marriage of your ruling family can only be proposed to a member of a noble family. You need to have a good relationship with the family, be wealthy and match the partner's orientation.
Quarters house all members of the clergy, but also act as a kitchen and warehouse where they collect the clergy tax. All clergy zones are non-taxable by law.
The removal tool has three modes and a set of filters. You can order the salvaging of a structure, cancel the construction blueprint or remove an existing salvaging order.
Each productive zone has a list of required structures. Often when villagers are not producing, it is because one of those required structures is missing, so make sure to pay close attention to them!
Rocks, clay rocks and trees can be manually removed in order to quickly harvest useful materials like stone, clay or wood.
A good place to harvest sand is at the shore of a river, lake or sea. The sand will slowly replenish there over time.

Completing listed deliveries offers additional bonuses, but you can also send a custom delivery. Resources you send contribute to their effect by their market value. You will need a free loading site and a laborer servant for each delivery.
Guard posts establish a range of detection. Any criminal within its range has a chance to be spotted and chased by the guard.
When placing forests, make sure to keep at least one tile between each tree. Too many trees will exhaust the soil and will lead to less than optimal growth.
Families will keep their produce taxed under socage in their storage until the first day of the next season. Then they transfer what they owe to your warehouse.
When editing two zones that share the same border, a new tile is added to the zone that is highlighted. Use the edit button on the zone to toggle which zone you wish to edit.

Sick people will visit the hospital and be tended by nurses. This consumes healing material and reduces the time for the sickness to be cured. Artisans and nobles stay in their own beds and nurses treat them in their homes.
A clergy tax allows you to supply the clergy with the resources they need. It reduces the necessity of manual donations and burdens on your own treasury.

Tenures can now be taxed with different policies. Socage taxes a percentage of production, Feefarm expects rent, Stewardry gives all production to you but requires a salary in return, and Frankalmoigne makes use of the land tax-free. Experiment with them for a variety of playstyles!
In the warehouse book, you can access information about what the selected family needs. Observe the tooltips next to each resource to get this information quickly.
Forest tiles are automatically generated in areas with a high density of trees. To remove the forest tiles and create farmable soil, you must remove all trees in the area and wait.
